data.text:
@EdTubb They say it's because the number of people who have had just one dose keeps fluctuating up and down:

"“People with one dose of double-dose vaccine” category has a small and constantly changing number. The combination will stabilize the results."
@EdTubb Similarly I’m sure there are lots of deaths post “acute” infection that could be attributed to COVID but aren’t.

@EdTubb So what killed the people that made up the other 97.5% of deaths not called Covid?

I'd like a fancy graph on that.

@EdTubb @TorontoStar Auditor General Releases Damning Report Detailing How Doug Ford’s Government Mismanaged COVID-19 Response
https://t.co/00SHiaJv2q
@EdTubb Would imagine a significant delta. Vaccines work, even with 1 dose
@EdTubb This is extremely noteworthy. Hopefully now the "if you get hit by a car and it turns out you had Covid, you're included in the Covid death numbers" people will STFU
@EdTubb But to say it's less than originally stated, is that not also factually correct?  75% is less than 100%, correct?
Also: Not sure why we'd lump together unvaxxed with the people who have 1 dose.
